title: Bankruptcy Clawback question
question: My question is if a company files for BK where I am a principal of the company, my understanding of the clawback clause is that anyone in the preceding 90 days has to return all payments that they received.
answers:
Wages paid to non-insiders generally not subject to clawback.
Different rules apply to principals.
Save self alot of time and money by retaining BK counsel for some pre-planning advice.

You very much need a business bankruptcy lawyer to help you through this process. There is a lot of planning that needs to be done to properly position a business for a smooth bankruptcy. You can find one on AVVO.

What does your lawyer say? No lawyer? Generally, wages/salary paid to employees is not subject to clawback. Unless there was some kind of disproportionate amounts for fake bonuses or loans disguised as wages/salary, you should be OK.
